Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for data governance, analytics, and compliance. Identify the data sources, types, and analytics use cases to be addressed by Microsoft Purview.
Design the architecture for data governance and analytics, including the integration of Microsoft Purview with existing data sources and analytics tools.
Create a Microsoft Purview account in the Azure portal and configure the initial settings, such as region and resource group.
Connect Microsoft Purview to the required data sources, such as Azure Data Lake, SQL databases, or on-premises data stores.
Configure scanning and classification rules to automatically discover and classify data assets in connected data sources.
Set up role-based access control (RBAC) and data access policies to ensure secure access to data assets and analytics.
Establish data governance policies, including data retention, data quality, and compliance requirements.
Configure data lineage tracking to visualize the flow of data across systems and processes.
Configure monitoring and alerting for data governance activities using Azure Monitor or other tools.
Perform testing to validate the configuration, including data scanning, classification, and lineage tracking. Ensure all policies and access controls are functioning as expected.
Document the setup, including configurations, policies, and operational procedures. Share the documentation with relevant stakeholders.
Provide training sessions for users and administrators on how to use Microsoft Purview for data governance and analytics.
Develop a plan for ongoing maintenance, including periodic scanning, policy updates, and monitoring.
Conduct regular audits to ensure compliance with data governance policies and identify areas for improvement.
Use monitoring tools to continuously check the health and performance of the Microsoft Purview Data Catalog. Identify and resolve any anomalies or issues.
Regularly review and validate data lineage information to ensure accuracy and completeness. Address any discrepancies or missing lineage data.
Conduct audits of metadata quality in the Purview Data Catalog to ensure compliance with organizational standards and policies.
Review and update data classification rules to align with evolving business requirements and regulatory changes.
Verify the security settings of Microsoft Purview, including access controls and encryption configurations, to ensure data protection.
Analyze and optimize analytics queries to improve performance and reduce resource consumption.
Regularly back up configuration settings and metadata stored in Microsoft Purview to ensure recoverability in case of data loss.
Regularly review analytics dashboards to ensure they provide accurate and actionable insights. Update dashboards as needed.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare for potential security breaches or data integrity issues within Microsoft Purview.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Microsoft Purview's analytics features. Implement improvements based on this feedback.
Perform regular compliance checks to ensure Microsoft Purview analytics operations adhere to relevant regulations and industry standards.
